features: You’ll receive 500 ruled 3x5 index cards from Oxford, shrink wrapped in packs of 100 for neat and organized note card storage
These 3 x 5 index cards are ruled on one side and blank on the other; use the ruled side for longer text or sentences and use the blank side for words, sketches or anything that requires open space
Always have these versatile note cards on hand for school supplies, teacher education supplies, craft supplies, office supplies and more; each card is 3 by 5 inches
Ruled index cards have plenty of creative and practical uses: consider making quick to-do lists, recipe cards, foreign language flash cards, or story outlines
Oxford Index Cards are proudly made in the USA
body.description: A 500 Pack of Oxford Index Cards is the perfect stock-up solution for all of your school, office and home organization needs. These 3x5 ruled index cards are packed in bundles of 100, so you can pull out a new pack when you’re ready to use. Ruled on one side, blank on the other, use these note cards as study cards, lists or labels or get creative and make artwork, small storybooks or crafts. 500 ruled 3" x 5" index cards. Made in the USA.

OXFORD. From classroom to career Discover our Oxford index cards, composition books, and study tools that propel so many from classroom to career.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Use These for Making Notes on All Sorts of Ideas, To-Dos, Etc.
reviews.reviewText: I use these and the 4" x 6" size cards for all sorts of things. I keep individual cards for contacts and their individual information - such as names, addresses, phone numbers, birthdays, anniversaries, kid's info, etc, as well as, "to-do" lists, grocery shopping - whatever list/info I need or want to make.These are sturdy, easily sorted, tuckable into books or a purse. I find more and more uses all the time and I'm sure you can too - even creating things I haven't thought of yet!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars They are decent index cards, but not as thick as the ones I used to buy...
reviews.reviewText: I use index cards a lot. I use them for grocery lists, notes, little reminders for my wife and kid, just generally lots of things instead of a paper notepad.I had a whole bunch of note cards and I finally was running out and needed to resupply. I bought these(the Oxford brand) as I have found the brand names to be a little better quality. The price for 500 cards was really good, so I figured this was a pretty good choice. Unfortunately, it was not exactly what I expected.When I cracked open a package of the cards, I found them to be much thinner and more flimsy than the cards I had before. They were not "paper thin", but they were not like card stock either. I would describe them as kind of thick paper, versus what I normally think of a "card stock".Since I still had a few old cards, I could compare them directly and the new ones were much thinner. They will still do the job, but they just feel a lot less like cards and more like thick note paper in an index card format.I guess it is like so many other things now where manufacturers are cutting costs. it is kind of like the grocery store where the item you used to buy is still the same price, but there isn't as much product in the box. This feels a little like that. I will use these, but next time I will look for something that is a little more like the index card that I am accustomed to using...a little sturdier and thicker. And I am perfectly willing to pay a little more for better quality...This may or may not matter to you for your purposes, so please understand there is nothing "wrong" with them...they just aren't what I expected, so I am only rating them 4 stars out of 5.
